question:
Consider the following pollutants:
  1. Sulphur dioxide
  2. Nitrogen dioxide
  3. Volatile organic compounds (VOCs)
 Which of the above is/are mainly responsible for acid rain?
explanation: Acid rain results when sulphur dioxide (SO<sub>2</sub>) and nitrogen oxides (NO<sub>X</sub>) are emitted into the atmosphere and transported by wind and air currents.  The SO<sub>2</sub> and NO<sub>X</sub> react with water, oxygen and other chemicals to form sulphuric and nitric acids. These then mix with water before falling to the ground.
